text:
Just finished our lunch at Fist of Fusion and left completely happy. We were warmly welcomed and our food was served hot and fresh. I got the sesame chicken and my wife got the garlic shrimp. I loved that the mac salad wasn't overly creamy or thick. The amount of shrimp that came in the bowl was awesome!! They definitely don't skimp. We finished our meal with a churro..... Delicious. 
This place is within walking distance so there's no keeping us away. we'll be back soon!
Awesome food and service! What more can you ask for??? The garlic shrimp and honey sesame tofu are my favorites.

Not such a great place to eat. Obnoxious music always playing in the restaurant with the volume on blast. The cashier seemed nice at first, but when I said I was ok on an explanation of the menu, she started giving me attitude when I was ordering. Hawaiian food is mediocre. Could be better. Again, L&L probably tastes the best.

The food was amazing especially the pulled pork nachos! Also had the garlic shrimp with grilled pineapple it was so tasty and loved the garlic with easy peal shrimp. Can't wait too try the rest of the menu. I don't really post on yelp but can't help say this was some amazing island food!!!
Great place to sit down and eat a good meal for a great price. The proportions on the mixed bowl were pretty perfect. I suggest the katsu chicken bowl, it was delicious!

I'm happy that my husband made me try this place! Everything we ordered was "Ono" (good).  We enjoyed our dishes while listening to Hawaiian- Reggae jams.  The owner recommended the chicken plate lunch burrito.  I need to think about this one for next time.  Being from Hawaii I feel that its wrong to put a plate lunch in a burrito (just my opinion).  I'm sure it's good but not ready for this combo.   

We ordered the garlic shrimp plate, crispy pork belly sisig bowl, crispy spam musubi and the Notorious RIB taco.  All were delicious especially with the pairing of POG lemonade.  I was kind of sad there was no corn, but heard it was just for today.  We will be back to try the corn!!! Thanks for bringing this Ono food to the southwest!!!

I got the crispy pork belly bowl which imo wasn't all that great.  i did like the crispy tocino spam musubi which was quite good but little pricey at $4+?  but i did want to try it.   would only go back if someone else wanted to eat there.
The tacos here are so good and the garlic shrimp was so close to Hawaii! Some of the best food we've had! Even the chicken had such great flavor!!
I love that they have different types of corn! The Uni-corn was a very fun one that I got! Will definitely be back to try the bowls they have !

Delicious local Hawaiian Filipino food! Kalua pig nachos is a must! We've been here twice already and everything we have ordered has been on point. You have a choice of two sides - mac salad, edamame, veggies or a salad and you can pick either brown rice or white rice. The burritos are also a must! They are huge so make sure you tell them to cut it in half because you will likely need to save the other half for later! Check this place out!

Three words: MONEY WELL SPENT. So glad this Los Angeles gem has made its way to Las Vegas! We waited a little for the hype to die down, but totally understand it now... We have been here TWICE in a week now! And it won't be the last time! You really get your bang for your buck -- the food is well portioned, filling AND satisfying!

The menu has a wide variety of hawaiian x filipino fusion food -- from appetizers, burritos, salads, tacos, entrees, and rice bowls. We both opted for the ISLAND RICE BOWLS:
- Choose your size (KIDS $5.99: 1 serving of protein, 1 scoop of rice, 1 side) (REGULAR $7.99: 1 servings of protein, 2 scoops of rice, 2 sides)
 (MIXED $9.99: 2 servings of protein, 2 scoops of rice, 2 sides)
- Choose your protein (teriyaki chicken, Notorious R.I.B. boneless shortribs, kalbi short ribs, sesame chicken, chicken katsu, kalua pork sisig, crispy pork belly sisig, honey sesame tofu, teriyaki veggies)
- Choose your sides (macaroni salad, green salad, grilled pineapple, stir fry vegetables, edamame)

I ordered (large island rice bowl):
- NOTORIOUS RIB
- SESAME CHICKEN
- MACARONI SALAD
- GRILLED PINEAPPLE
- WHITE RICE 
...and I will continue to get this same order forever! The Notorious RIBs are perfectly marinated & cooked tender boneless short ribs, topped with a tasty slaw -- and the sesame chicken is so crispy & cunchy with a delicious flavorful side sauce that I just want to smother on EVERYTHING! The mac salad is a common necessary side staple, and the grilled pineapple is such a yummy sweet mix to add to the dish! We just barely finish our plate (even on our hungriest days) and just can't get over how satisfying, fresh and filling the food is! (He ordered the notorious rib, chicken katsu, mac salad and mixed veggies... but uses my sesame chicken sauce, haha.)

Will we be back? Without question! (We even had to vow to wait at least a week in between our next visit since we've been here so frequent!) Especially with this gem just around the corner from our house, located on Buffalo x Warm Springs next to the PT's Ranch. I love my order, but vow to definitely try other items on the menu (I have been eyeing the different kinds of elote like MISO-CORNY, or the KALUA PORK NACHOS and NOTORIOUS RIB BURRITO)! =)

A must try is the Kahlua Pork Nachos.  This Hawaiian Fusion Restaurant is definitely a must for anyone who is a true Foodie. Their island style incorporates Hawaiian inspired dishes served in a burritos/tacos/bowls style.  I know this sounds boring but favorite dish is the Sesame Chicken and Honey Sesame Tofu.  So for you Veggie eaters, there's even dishes made just for your discriminating taste.  Ask for the free Hawaiian style Churros.
Great food ! Small but great selection of food. Friendly staff.  Got the pork belly appetizer.  And crispy pork belly sisig. Both the bomb !

Every time I come here, their rice is ALWAYS wet and mushy. That's what happens if you add too much water in your rice. Besides the terrible rice they serve, I don't like anything else. 

Their garlic shrimp is meh. The shrimp they use is NOT good quality. I feel like it's the packaged ones in the freezer aisle. I'm not paying $13 for that. 
The spam in the musubi was paper thin, and super plain. Every time I've had musubis at other Hawaiian joints, it's a pretty thick slice and marinated or has some kind of added teriyaki sauce. The ones here is just soggy rice, spam wrapped in seaweed. 
Their sisig was decent, but it wasn't anything to rave about. 
My least favorite item on the menu are the tacos. The tortillas weren't served warm. They also came straight out of a plastic bag. I got about 4 pieces of meat inside the taco and it was served on a plastic lid. Definitely nothing special and it was easily something I could've recreated at home. 

If you live in the area, I'd try Makai or Island Flavor for your Hawaiian craving.
What a great new addition to the neighborhood! I had the Teriyaki Chicken, Mac Salad, and Grilled Pineapple- all absolutely delicious!!!

The vibe is right. The short rib taco was good. The picture attached is the short rib taco and a kids bowl, which they graciously let me purchase even though I'm 29. Next time I would probably just get a regular sized bowl with short rib, white rice, and the macaroni salad. Overall it was very good and the music was chill.

I was excited about trying the food here after having read amazing reviews about this place. I chose the Mixed Island Rice Bowl ($9.99) with two scoops of Brown Rice topped with Teriyaki Chicken, Honey Sesame Tofu, Macaroni Salad, Grilled Pineapple, and a Tropical Lemonade. My friend also chose a similar order with two scoops of White Rice topped with Teriyaki Chicken, Kalua Pork Sisig, Macaroni Salad, Green Salad, and a soda fountain drink. In addition, they gave us Furikake Churro which is on the house. 

Honestly, I'm not happy with the meal I ordered. The Teriyaki Chicken taste okay. The meat isn't as tender as it should be and the portions are quite small for a large bowl. The Honey Sesame Tofu is a bit on the sweeter side. If they could've add a little spice like Sriracha to it, it would've balance the sweetness and make the meal taste better. On a brighter note, I do like the Macaroni Salad and Grilled Pineapple. These are actually sides and are the only ones that taste good.

I was told the Tropical Lemonade ($2.79) had Passion Fruit, Orange, and Guava in it, but all I can taste is concentrated sugar water. Also keep in mind the best quality churro is served warm, crispy, and it's enjoyable to eat. The churros that we were given taste kind of sad, it needed more time to fry, its texture is so dense and chewy, and there is hardly any Furikake sprinkled on it. It's just massive amount of sugar on undercooked dough. I ended up taking most of my meal home. Thankfully I have bottled water in my car and I drank up that water like there's no tomorrow.

Tried this place out for the first time. Environment is pretty chill and relaxing cashier and server had a a lot of Aloha, great customer ordered Kalua nachos, garlic shrimp, and notorious RIB... all super delicious and very filling. The only thing was I thought the garlic shrimp was a bit in the salty side.

The also gave complimentary churro, which I didn't enjoy very much.
 
Otherwise everything else was perfect!
Great staff great service!

Fam and I went to this place after seeing so many pics of the food. It was a little farther for us to get to but it was well worth it. The place is small, seats about 20-25 people...maybe. A bit congested if the place was full. It has a cool wall painting. 

We ordered the R.I.B burrito, a couple of bowls (rice, crispy pork belly, R.I.B meat, chicken katsu, Mac salad), Mexicorn and Cheetoscorn, and Kailua pork nachos. The food was very delicious, good portions, and pleasing to the eyes. 

I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who loves Hawaiian/Island food. The staff and the chefs were awesome, great customer service and very friendly. I'll be coming back real soon!
Not was I was expecting but ok. I do like the art on the wall tho. Food was good, I had t he garlic shrimp ... musubi I really liked there presentation

We ordered LocoMoco,Garlic Shrimp and we got FREE fried Pork using our Yelp check in. Food is good and the lemonade drink was a bit too sweet for me but it was good. The portion of the food we got was a lot it almost like it can be shared. My most fave was the fried pork most definitely will be trying that again..

Ummmm. Unfortunately, I was not impressed. I ordered Kalua Pork Nachos and Kalbi Short Rib Bowl. House Made Chips for Nachos were over-fried and greasy which made it not appetizing. For the bowl, white rice was very mushy. Kalbi was tasty which was good, but the Mac Salad was very bland. So sad because I was hoping to find a great Hawaiian place..
This is probably my favorite Hawaiian restaurant in town. We will definitely come back and love that they have a rewards system and can accumulate points to use as credit to get free food.

What a hidden gem. This place is like a fancy shrimp taco truck you'd find in Hawaii. A little bit of Hawaii in a restaurant... :)

Tried the crispy pork belly rice bowl, mexicorn, garlic shrimp, garlic honey sriracha chicken wings.... the crispy pork... awesome. Only thing is I wish I could've had kimchi or something with more spice to balance out my food. The mexicorn... meh. It wasn't what I was hoping for... not bad but not the best. Best thing is portions are very generous. 

Overall it was delicious. The place is a little small so may not be the best for larger groups. The people there were super friendly. They were vigilant in asking if we needed anything else. Music  was in point. 

Definitely recommend.

I was on a different side of town for an appointment so I checked yelp for a lunch recommendation! :) I ordered spam musubi. I know that isn't a lot to base the whole restaurant on but it was yummy. I noticed that it did NOT have a strong spell when I unwrapped it, like other restaurants have sometimes. That alone made me want to write a review. 

The girl that took my order was friendly and the restaurant is decorated in a cute way! They were pretty busy when I was there. Almost every table was taken at 1:00pm on a Friday!

If I'm in the area again, I will definitely stop by because I wanted to try the fried spam musubi and the pork belly. I just wasn't hungry enough that day lol! I also noticed they have a check in offer right now!

Came here for lunch and it was pretty busy!!! Their menu is pretty appealing to me and it was hard for me to choose just one dish but the garlic shrimp really stood out to me! So I ordered the garlic shrimp plate and I loved it!! The garlic shrimp was full of flavors! I had it with brown rice, macaroni salad and lettuce (salad but it really was just plain lettuce). My coworker got the garlic chicken plate and I tried a chicken wing, it wouldn't say it was the best because I've had better, but it's still worth a try.

I'll be back to try their other items on the menu!

I love short ribs, so I ordered a bone in short rib and boneless option. This is was worst short ribs I've ever had! Very disappointed. The boneless ribs were dry and flavorless and it was overcooked. The bone in ribs were very low quality. The Mac salad was good though. Will not be coming back.

I really wanted to like this place, but unfortunately I was so dissapointed! I came here with a co-worker for lunch, and it was packed! So I took that as a good thing. Naturally lots of people would mean it was worth it right?
I was wrong! There was a lot of people there because they have been waiting for thier food for quite some time. I observed several mistakes by the staff repeatedly; wrong orders, wrong sides, missing sides, and people going up asking where thier food was. At one point one of thier employees ran in with bagfulls of meat from La Bonita! That just looked terrible, at least walk in from the back? Customer's should not have to see that. This was a huge red flag for me.
My order took 25 minutes to come out, plus they gave me the incorrect rice. I ordered the the sisig as my protien and it was pretty bland. Only the sides I ordered (pinapple and macaroni salad) and fountain drink were really okay...
My co-workers spam masubi barely had any spam and was stuffed with way more rice than it should have, and her veggie sides were soggy. I also got a rice bowl, and it was honestly more rice than my proteins and sides. I will not be back.

Tasty spin on Hawaiian Food located in the Southwest area. 

I stopped by here for dinner tonight and ordered taco sisig, regular teriyaki chicken bowl with grilled veggies & Mac salad, and regular boneless ribs bowl with veggies & Mac salad. 

I preferred the teriyaki chicken over boneless ribs, but I must say the taco sisig was the most impressive and super tasty. 

Portion size for both bowls and sisig were right. Actually a bit more than what we expected. So price was just right. 

I would definitely recommend this place if you're looking to try new Hawaiian food in the southwest area.

Brand new to the southwest, its a new Hawaiian/Filipino fast casual that has a great menu with savory dishes. The employees are friendly and the place is clean. If you are in the southwest area by Buffalo and Warm Springs stop by and satisfy your taste buds.

First time here after seeing the foodie influencers post delicious pics, definitely had to come give this place a try.  Fist of Fusion definitely exceeded our expectations, especially since it is filipino fusion.. thought it would be similar to other infused restaurants in the area but we can't wait to be back to try other items on the menu! We wished we could have ordered it all! Location is kind of hidden but love the atmosphere and vibe it gives off, great service. So nice & welcoming. The food is ono! Definitely must try the POG lemonade & take advantage of their check in offers.

One of the reasons I love living in Las Vegas? It's the 9th island and Hawaii local kine grinds can be found everywhere. 

Tip: Don't come here expecting Giovanni's garlic shrimp 2750 miles away from the iconic food truck. You will be disappointed. That's an unrealistic expectation. 

But, Fist of Fusion does a wonderful job featuring familiar flavors with their own special twist. 

The service is friendly and fast. The music is awesome. I will be back soon!

This Hawaiian/Filipino spot on the corner of Buffalo and Warm Springs Rd. is packed with island flavor!!! It's only befitting that Fist of Fusion Island Grill whose based in So Cal, opened their 2nd location on the Ninth Island aka Las Vegas!

Step in here and they already treat you like ohana with their warm smiles and "Aloha!" greeting.  

What's offered up here are some Hawaiian and Filipino favorites served in taco, or burrito form. Island style salads pack some nutritional value, that's next on my list to try!  Or you can choose Island Rice Bowls where you can pick an additional two sides and your choice white/brown rice.

Well since Ive limit myself to not having meat, my go to order here is the Honey Sesame Tofu. The tofu is marinated with sesame miso dressing..So ono!!

Grilled Pineapple! - Get that for one of your sides!! Taking a bite into warm juicy pineapple is so onolicious!

When I ordered the keiki size Pork Belly Sigsig, for me...I didnt get stink eye. Perfect serving size for my post workout recovery meal. Eggs are protein! Pork Belly is brok' da mout!


Ambience - small space but good use of dining area with booths and tables. You got Sammy J playin on the video screen. Their surfboard counter/hi top with stools is where you'll usually find me.  Love staring at the mural.. a homage to Hawaiian and Filipino culture. Whoever the artist is..five stars to you too!! It's beautiful! The window faces the mountains...not quite islandy, but hey everything else here has the island vibe and ono grindz!

Fist of Fusion is a great spot for a first date to screen someone for their relationship potential. Long story short, if a guy can hang through a trip here AND you get some action afterward despite the garlic breath from the Shrimp Plate, he's a keeper. 

The Steps:
1. Insist on driving. If he doesn't complain about your speed/music selection or repeatedly ask why you're passing several other Hawaiian restaurants on your way to this specific place, that's common sense AND compatibility.
2. Insist on getting the Shrimp Plate. If he doesn't bitch about it being the highest price item on the menu, you're off to a good start. Bonus points if he takes your recommendation and orders the same thing, and then doesn't complain if you steal a shrimp off his order. Sharing is caring!
3. Chat through your meal and if you're still feeling it, refer to the first paragraph. Garlic is amazing and if that's a deterrent for him, he's not worth it anyway.

For real though, the Garlic Shrimp Plate is amazing- ~$14 for about 10 shrimp, doused in garlic, with plenty of rice, a scoop of mac salad, and a little bit of greens. The shrimp are large and fresh, and have been cooked perfectly on my two trips out here so far. 

The menu isn't all classic Hawaiian, they feature Filipino and fusion items too. I keep meaning to try the chicken wings and the Notorious RIB burrito (complete with mac salad INSIDE THE TORTILLA) but the shrimp keeps winning me over. They also have elotes!

Everything was delicious. The customer service is great. They gave us a churro for waiting and we loved it. It's not like churros you get from other places. The furikake they put on it was a nice touch with a great taste. The pog lemonade was so bomb I think it's one of the best lemonade I tasted. My plate lunch was so delicious. It's a boneless beef (like kalbi) will be coming back to sure
The garlic shrimp was delicious and a good sized portion. I def wanna come back and try the rest of the menu!

I've been looking for a good Hawaiian Fusion place and luckily one opened up near my house! Many options on the menu that make my mouth drool just reading them! Great Customer service and most Importantly GREAT FOOD! Definitely coming back!

Ordered a 2 meat plate, sesame chicken and boneless  short ribs with macaroni salad and salad for sides. The sesame chicken is very crispy and I love how they use dark meat. The short ribs tasted more like the beef cubes from a beef stew that shreds. It was very tasty, but just wasn't I thought to be boneless short ribs. I also ordered panko breaded spam masubi. It added more crunch to the typical masubi and tocino sauce drizzle added more flavor.
I will not go back here. Don't order the boneless short ribs bowl nor the Hawaiian chicken salad. They're both awful.

Found this place on yelp and decided to give it a try! Being from Maui, its always exciting when a local food joint opens up. My boyfriend and I decided to drive across town to try it. 

The interior and the structure of the restaurant is nice and welcoming. The location was not hard to find at all and parking was not a hassle.

I ordered the Keiki size with white rice, Kalbi, and Mac salad. We saw that people recommended the lemonade so we got that too! 

Through pictures the food looked amazing, but we were disappointed when we got to try it ourselves. The rice was hard, the Mac salad was bland, and the Kalbi was okay. The only item I really enjoyed was the lemonade. On the car ride home we even started to feel a bit sick. 

As far as service, one of the girls there was really nice and checked up on us every now and then. The girl who took our order wasn't as friendly.

The manager reached out to me to give them a 2nd chance. So I gave it another shot and yes 2nd time around was much better. I got the loco moco again to see if the gravy was changed and yup brown gravy yums! I also ordered the spam musubi no pink sauce, much,  much better!
yum the grilled pineapple is amazing. The pork belly appetizer. Overall it's a great nice place to the neighborhood

Decided to try this place because it looked fun and tasty. The music is a little loud but it has an inviting atmosphere. I love Hawaii so I enjoyed the island theme. I ordered a mixed bowl. I got it with white rice, garlic shrimp, stir fry veggies, and grilled pineapple. The bowl was overall pretty good. The garlic shrimp gave the rice a good flavor and the grilled pineapple was a nice twist. My only complaint is there were a few chunks of carrot in the stir fry veggies that didn't seem to be cooked all the way and it threw off the texture for me. I would say without the carrots it would've been better. My friend ordered their kalua pork and he said it was bland and had no flavor. I think I'll go back to this place again just for the shrimp!

I just had to check this place out after seeing the yummy pictures on Instagram. Props to whoever does the page because it definitely got me in the door. The food was delicious. I ordered the plate lunch burrito, spam musubi and a drink. My total was $15 and some change. The burrito was amazing. It had white rice, grilled chicken, grilled veggies, cabbage, mac salad, and two kinds of sauce - yum! The spam musubi was standard, but I love spam musubi. For me the food was 5 stars. The service on the other hand needs some work.

When I placed my order, the girl told me 10 minutes but it ended up being around 25 minutes. Most of the food was already cooked, so the workers just had to basically assemble everything. There were only 2 girls working  though and anytime someone came in, one of them had to stop and cashier. I think things would run a lot smoother if they had one dedicated cashier. I almost had to ask for my money back because it kept getting later and later with no food. Seriously a burrito takes like 2 seconds to make, especially since they just had to put the ingredients on the tortilla and roll it up. The musubi was already made. I finally got my food but because it was so late, I had to rush back to work and eat in the car (hence no pictures), so I didnt really get to savor the burrito, but man it was good. I will definitely be back, but I might place my order in advance if I am crunched on time.

Went there for the first time the other night with my cousin. The menu just looked so amazing it was hard to make a decision. The customer service was awesome!! Front the ladies in the front to the cook in the back. They even passed out free churro samples for everyone dining in. The food was soooooo ono!!!!! Definitely will be stopping by again!
Excellent!! The flavors are truly amazing and with an awesome island flare!!!

It's not your typical Hawaiian joint or Filipino restaurant. They have sisig everything. Tried them twice before doing a review. The food is just OK for my taste. Nothing really stood out to make me want to come back and get. 
The Notorious RIB burrito had all sorts of flavors jammed packed in each bite. Basicslly a whole hawaiian plate inside. Its a large portion too, that I was only able to eat half of it. 
Tocino musubi was too sweet for my taste buds from the sauce with too much rice. 
Furikake churro was bomb.com! If you check in on yelp, you can try the pork belly appetizer. The hawaiian style twist to their dishes were not grabbing my attention. Dont know what all the hype is about.

Place recently opened up and decided to give it a try. Outside is clean, huge doors, and a surprised welcome as we walk in. It's a small joint but it can definitely be a family place to eat. I got the Tocino crispy spam musubi and the short rib rice bowl (bone in). Pretty damn good food and good portions too. Their story is pretty cool and posted by the bathroom. They also gave us complimentary churros before we left too. Highly recommend giving this place a try. Average pricing, good food and excellent customer service. Would definitely go again.

Sooo the wife and I were looking for places near by which had good reviews. I remember having a friend post a picture of the meals he had while he was there, boy did they look amazing. I asked the wife if she wanted to give Fist of Fusion a shot and she was on board. 

I ordered the Loco Moco (which I have had at another place close by) and I have to truthful and say that this is probably the best Loco Moco I have ever had! The burger was cooked to perfecting, the egg was tasty, and the gravy with mushroom was absolutely delicious! 

The wife ordered the Garlic Shrimp and she absolutely loved it. We placed an order for pick-up online and were a bit hesitant on if they would get things right. But they nailed it, the shrimp was peeled like we wanted and the order was flawless. I got a taste of her Garlic Shrimp and again, I wasn't let down. It was incredible. 

I never post reviews on yelp, as this is my first one ever. I want this to be my first review because this place is freaking awesome. Although it's a start to explore more of the menu, we recommend this for all who are in the area and want a damn good meal for a great price. 

Great Job Fist of Fusion and welcome to SW Las Vegas.

Heard about another local food spot just opened in Vegas. Always always stay down when comes to local food not only because from 808 but best comfort food ever two scoops rice, mac salad, and entree. I must admit had my reservations cause over the past twenty years living in Vegas (or locals know call Vegas the ninth island) almost over saturated with local spots. The ones that truly stand out for me is individual family own restaurant nothing to do with chains (not that hater still good). Not only does Fist of Fusion Island Grill stand out writing it or saying it out loud. It truly embodies Ohana. I never had conversation with Ronnie or Lisa but reading other reviews. Chef Ronnie was making the rounds asked me how was everything I had for lunch. A new business when see the owner takes time out to come out get feedback from every guest. Not only does it show his passion for his food, also like past review shows that each customer is not customer but part of the Ohana, and felt like living back in the 808.

So first impression was talk about feeling the Aloha spirit! Not only on the wall with coolest sign that the world needs more of. The staff shouting out Mahalos and welcome. They were consistent with every one that came in the hour chilling having my lunch. It small restaurant but has lot of personality in it. The art work on the wall soon walk in. It pretty much covers that whole wall. It looks very much original. It vibrant colors that screams at you. Hula girl with ukulele. Just chilling on the beach. The shaka sign from the logo to the open and close sign on the door. The sit down counter area. It screams personality but very much 808. Above they have three wide screens. The music!!!! So awesome!!! It totally local style Hawaiian music.

The food the menu has nice diversity to it. It not huge menu. It broken down to bowls, burritos, tacos, salads, apps, and ono grindz. It was my first visit not sure where to start. I know the Crispy Torino Span Musubi. One of the reasons came. I have been in this non spam musubi style kick. I seen the katsu style spam musubi but never had one. Talk about WINNAH. I know seen others that the whole musubi is deep fried. Never had so no going compare. I feel Crispy Torino Spam Musubi. If going katsu style this does Spam Musubi right. Only the Spam that breaded katsu style with the panko action. The rest of it is normal spam musubi. The part that separates Crispy Torino Spam Musubi from nothing had before is the tocino sauce. It perfect compliment to the crispy breading with what tastes like aioli based sauce or am guessing. Good. My entree went with the Sesame Chicken Bowl. The bowl comes in three different sizes. I went with the large. Talk about choke food. I was hungry after morning swim set. The amount of chicken give you is local style, the two scoops of rice is mound not scoop, and bowls come with choice of sides. I went with mac salad (cause dah two scoops rice mac salad need I say more) and stir fry vegetables. The mac salad was solid and the stir fry vegetables was nice medley of all fresh vegetables nice crispy and tell fresh vegetables. I was loved the sauce that coated the chicken and then get some on the side. All good stuff.

Little touch comes details. All the bowls or notice all the bowls coming out that day. They had flower in them. It nice one that see back home. All I was thinking if going out of way make it feel like Hawaii that nice touch. 

No doubt plan on coming back because close to my house. The boneless short ribs other dish torn apart to try first. This churro missed out on need try some of that too. Till the next time...

This place is a little hidden but finding the corner it's tucked into is worth the hunt. 

They are always friendly, fast, and have fair portion sizes. The flavor is unique with variations of traditional sauces that compliment each item I've tasted. 

Fun names too. 

There's also a little story about how they got their name but I will let you find it out and add to the treasure of searching for this spot.

So this is Fist of Fusion Island Grill. You'll probably only see the "Island Grill" and the shaka parts of their sign outside and assume it's just another Hawaiian restaurant. It's not. It's fusion. What they serve is fusion. You've been warned. I'm not going to hate the fact it's fusion. I'm ok with fusion. I just wasn't a fan of their fusion. Came here 3 times so I was trying to give them a chance.

On my 1st visit I ordered the regular size bowl ($7.99) bone-in short ribs (+$2) with 2 scoops rice, mac salad, and a grilled pineapple on the side.  The pineapple was the best part and all it was was a grilled pineapple. The mac salad and short rib was nothing special. Sure the pic may look nice but I didn't like it it was more like beef jerky to me. I tried to order the free crispy pork belly app with yelp check-in but they ran out. I was there when they just opened for lunch.

On my 2nd visit I took the parents. We ordered 3 large size bowls of various items share. They messed up the orders twice. Once after the order was placed and one more time when the food was ready. I thought it was fixed the 1st time. The end result? One bowl was some bone-in short ribs and this kalua pork sisig with slaw thing. The short ribs were cooked differently this time. They weren't like beef jerky which was better but I still didn't like it.  There was also less pieces than my 1st visit. The 2nd bowl had teriyaki chicken and kalua pork sisig. The 3rd bowl had tofu and sesame chicken. There was bad words said while eating. No one wanted to eat more after sampling everything and the food remained untouched in the fridge over the weekend. The free crispy pork belly app was nothing good also.

The 3rd visit I ordered the loco moco. You can't mess up loco moco can you? There's nothing to it. Rice, fried egg, and gravy. The eggs had furikake on it which is how I usually make my eggs at home. The gravy was different. Needed more gravy not because the taste of the gravy there was just wasn't a lot of gravy in the bowl. A friend ordered short ribs thinking they were getting short ribs with the bone in it, you know the usual way it's served. Whatever was brought out I wasn't going to trade with him even though he was kind of looking at my plate. 

They use paper bowls. Seems like they're trying to be eco friendly. A good amount of rice got stuck to the bowls. If you start scraping sure the rice comes off the bowl but with some paper from the bowl. Also it doesn't hold up too well on to go orders. Took it a few miles away and bowls were all wet.

Honestly I'd rather go to the other restaurants around the area like Island Flavor, Ohana, and L & L just to name a few. I'm going to Island Flavor now.

I was super excited to try this place because of the reviews and the pictures but I will never come back. The staff was so rude, I went to the counter to let the girls know that I was missing my drink they completely ignored me then one of them went to get it, put it in the counter and walked away. I wanted to have a nice lunch with my son but I felt so disrespected.They weren't busy at all either.The food was super greasy and didn't taste good. It was a complete waste of time and money. I have never been treated so bad at a restaurant before, but there's a first time for everything. Hope this doesn't happen to anyone else.

Omgggggg the food here was enough for a family of 4 to take home, fall asleep, wake up and finish. That burrito with the kalbi ribs, the nachos, the Cheeto-lote, bowls, everything was PHENOMENAL. CANT WAIT TO GO BACK!!! Although them being right up the street will likely hurt my bank account lol
Amazing restaurant and great service. Very creative in their dishes and something new to the island feel of food!!!

We are from Big Island and this food is not at all an "Island Grill". When we went they had run out of Nori so could not make spam musubi. They offered spam Katsu instead......that sounded great but the plate is just gross. They drizzled some kind of pink sauce on top which we assumed was an aioli... We also ordered a crispy pork belly bowl, it had a few pork belly pieces which had been tossed with kalua pig and cabbage. 
It's a bummer, we were stoked to see this place being built and could not wait to try it. Most likely won't go back, the food was that bad. Total disappointment:(

I wanted to like this place. I really tried. The food is seriously lacking in flavor and the free pork belly appetizer we got was hard as a rock. Someone could chip a tooth on it for realz. The people were really nice, but with so many other delicious options in town I won't be back.
Go here.  Get the shrimp plate.  Get the short rib burrito.  Get the lemonade.   Get corn.

My son had the crunchy spamasubi for lunch and dinner! He couldn't stop talking about it so he had to take me for dinner. I had the Kalua pork sisig with side of pineapple and it was delicious! My husband had the burrito with chicken and macaroni salad inside and I had it again for lunch because of the large serving. Definitely going back again!

We wanted to try a different Hawaiian eatery, so we opted for this place instead of another up the road. We liked the Hawaiian vibe as we entered; however the food wasn't great. I bought the garlic shrimp thinking it was fried, but it came out really soggy. The batter must of been beer batter. Tasted strange, and definitely not garlicky.

I was in the mood for some rice and anything and I Fist of Fusion and so glad I did!  I went to Hawaii last year and that was the last time I had a decent garlic shrimp dish until I found this place! 

The shrimp were huge which was totally unexpected!  I didn't get shrimp that big in Oahu. Great taste and I couldn't even finish it. I will definitely go back! I highly recommend you try it.

Food was delicious!!! portion was well worth the price!!! Employees were nice!!! Shrimp plate was ON POINT!!! Pork belly sisig and katsu was very flavorful!!! And the Loco Moco was of the wall!!! This was our first visit cause of convenience but not our last!!! Great job!!! Will be sharing my great experience with everyone!!!

Yummy and fast
My bf and I shared a two entree two side meal along with a corn. We were both full at the end. 

BBQ (boneless ribs) and crispy pork sisig  with macaroni and pinapple 
We also each had a lemonade (their soda machine was out) 

We liked the BBQ a lot more flavorful
I LOVED my pinapple
And the juice was a perfect match
I remember the food truck days. Food is always on point. Friendly staff. Clean restaurant. \m/
Cute place. Had the kalua pork bowl and the short rib bowl. Both very good. Washed down with the POG lemonade - good, b

Hawaiian cuisine is not something I've been exposed to, and Fist of Fusion seemed like a safe but logical choice to dive in and try authentic Hawaiian eats. The grilled pineapple and avocado sides were a great healthy compliment to the mixed plate of juicy garlic shrimp and crispy chicken katsu. I enjoyed my lunch here and ability to create your own meal so I definitely want to return. Fist of Fusion is tucked into a newly constructed plaza off Buffalo / Warm Springs.
This place is so freakin good.  I love it.  We came here twice while we were in Vegas.
A little on the pricey side but the food speaks for itself. This is honestly one of my favorite "plate lunch" spots in town. High quality ingredients and it shows!

Absolutely love the garlic shrimp...

They have a great menu can't wait to come back and try other items.
Omg best Hawaiian food ever  I'm not Hawaiian but I've tried quite a few places and this one takes the cake. The bowls and tacos are amazing

Umm I was expecting some "ono grinds"- but in reality it was" oh no I need a refund". I ordered 3 bowls and one of the bowls had a hair on it... bruhhhhh. Then when i finally tasted my bowl it was bland, Mac salad was dry but  chicken was alright . My suggestion for this place is to add seasonings,  the hype was not met rather go to aloha grill .. #disappointed something missing

Decent price. Food was good and service is great I would come back here again when ever my kids feel like eating Hawaiian food again. Food came quick and the environment is clean. I would recommend this place to every one
First time here and it was so good! Close to my work so I had to give it a try! Definitely coming back.

Just had the Garlic Shrimp Plate which was delicious. Good garlic flavor and shrimp cooked just right. It hit the spot for my shrimp and rice craving. Portion size was appropriate for what you pay. Staff are friendly and knowledgeable. Dining area is a bit small...well let's just say cozy. Bathrooms were clean. I'm coming back to try more. Good spots to park and there's a PT's right next door for the beers afterwards.

Came here for lunch and had the sesame chicken bowl with 1/2 brown and 1/2 mac salad, grilled pineapple and green salad. The bubbly delicious Pepsi from their Pepsi fountain was the perfect compliment to lunch- thank you for serving my favorite soda! 

Nice size portions of everything! The sesame chicken was very crispy which I love - soggy chicken is never a good thing- and the sauce was sweet and paired perfectly with the brown rice. The mac salad was one of the best I've had- creamy and full of flavor. The green salad was fresh green leaf lettuce with a light, sweet dressing. I saved the fresh grilled pineapple for last and it absolutely hit the spot.

It's near my work so I tried this place for lunch the first time yesterday. Had to wait in line for a while and then it took 15 minutes for the food to be ready, but it was right after noon, so that's what I get for going during peak rush. 

I ordered the large portion of pork belly sisig bowl with brown rice, macaroni salad and veggies. I appreciated the big portions and the everything was tasty. There were a few pieces of the pork skin that were over-fried to point of I couldn't chew them up, but that was not prevalent and I don't want to over-emphasize this.  Bottomline, I'm going to go back again, hopefully when it's less busy, and give it another try.

Was expecting more from all the reviews planned our family dinner . Overall the food was mediocre . The owner was super friendly as well as staff . We ordered the boneless ribs bowl . Sesame chicken bowl , with boneless ribs . And the pork bowl. The food was just ok .

Ordered: 
Notorious RIB (boneless short rib) with brown rice and a side of green salad.

My food and the service was really good! The food was made to order. The only reason why I gave them four stars instead of five is because it does take about 25-35 min or so for your order to be ready. So if you're going to this place during your lunch break, I suggest ordering your food ahead of time. 

Would definitely go back!

*Updated review on the short ribs

I was informed that they had changed vendors for their short ribs so I had to give them another try, and this time, they were nothing short on the short ribs. They tasted soooooo much better! In fact, they were some of the best short ribs I've had in quite awhile. Super juicy, tender, and flavorful! If you're ever craving short ribs, FoF is currently thee spot to get them!

Also tried tried the Crispy pork belly this time, and it was really tasty! It had really good textures. The skin was super crisp, but the pork itself was really soft and moist. The cilantro lime sauce also gave the pork a nice kick to it. 

And did I mention the guava lemonade? I'm usually not a huge fan of lemonade, but that drink converted me into a fan. So refreshing!

Service was friendly and accommodating as usual. Looks like I'll be coming back, tomorrow.

Came in at 11:30am on a Sunday thinking it would be fast, but no. We had 2 people order before us and 2 people sitting down that already ordered waiting for their food. We waited literally 25 minutes for our food. Food came out thinking the wait was going to be worth it. I got a loco moco, it was actually really good but for waiting 25 minutes the food should atleast be hot, it was pretty warm almost cool. My girlfriend got the garlic shrimp plate, it was warmish almost cold, and it was super mushy. No crisp like it looks on (Instagram food pages) SMH. Overall had a bad experience with this place. Wish it was how it looked and sounded on social media.

Hard to have given 3 stars. We are all about supporting local spots but I'm also all about supporting good food. We drove across town to try out this place. We were greeted as we walked in, nice little atmosphere and loved the island vibe and music. Prices are reasonable. Looking at spending about 23.00 for two meals and two regular drinks. We went to the front to look at the menu and girl ( no name tag) upfront asked if we were ready and I told her we were still looking. She was not personable at all . When we went in it wasn't that busy that she could of made an effort to make small talk with us and give us some ideas of what their top sellers were. She clearly saw us looking at their menu and their choices of elote . Though she did state if we had questions to ask. When finally ordering we tried to order one of their elotes and she said "oh we are out of corn". Should of put a sign up or even state they are out when we were looking at the menu.  Also only choice of diet soda was out of order. So what brought us here? We saw some pictures of their food on UNLOKT. Pictures they have posted look better than what the food tastes like. No flavor. Also another friend who is a "foodie" stated they were good. I got the chicken katsu meal. 1 protein, 2 scoops of rice, and 2 sides for $9.99. I got veggies and macaroni salad as my sides. Side means two tablespoons of macaroni salad and 1/2 cup of grilled soggie onions, a piece of red bell pepper , and 1 cube of zucchini. Maybe I didn't get their popular dish but no excuse to not have fresh veggies cooked and I had seen containers of food behind counter. Rice and veggies .. setup look like something at chipotle. So you know veggies are not cooked fresh. Definitely not a place to go out of your way for.

It was okay. Came mostly for the garlic shrimp. I haven't been to Hawaii so I have nothing to compare it to, but it wasn't what I imagined.  I gotta go to Hawaii and see what it's really about!  the rib meat was pretty good. The best thing was the crispy Tocino spam musubi.  It just fell apart and was really messy. Had to experience it for myself though.

This place is addicting!! By far one of the best hidden Hawaiian restaurants in Vegas. 

Have not been disappointed with any of our orders. Always made sure to try something different. A couple of things that are on my favorite list: garlic shrimp, garlic honey sriracha wings, spam masubi, and the Uni- corn!! The POG (passion fruit, orange juice, guava) is a must have if you like fruity drinks! 

Onolicious is the beat description for their food!!

Such a bomb place! We ordered the unicorn corn which was so cool so pretty. We also ordered the hot Cheeto corn which was so good. The corn was perfect and flavors were on point. And also had there really tasty tropical lemonade. And how sweet of them to have given us complimentary churros they were interesting sweet and a little hit on salt was incredible. Definitely don't forget to come here.

Their food is pretty tasty and the service is excellent. I'd definitely go back. We weren't sure what to order and they gave us great recommendations which were great. The next time we are in Las Vegas we will definitely eat here again.

My girlfriend was the one that told me about this place as she drove by a few times and knew that I lived near by. 

The next day, my husband and I attempted to go, on a Sunday at 4:59 pm, to which I could see they were closed and sweeping up. I visited the following day to pick up dinner. This is when I found out, this was their soft opening week and Sunday was their very first day.  I also learned from the owner/chef, what the correct hours would be: M - Sat 11 - 9 and Sunday from 11 to 7.

Being filipino and growing up in HI, one would think that I got this, but I honestly can say that the menu is different from other filipino or Hawaiian-style restaurants. For the most part, there's a twist to many of the items on the menu, which is a good thing.

It took me a few minutes to figure out what to order, plus my husband texted me to change his order twice! 

With the two times that I have been to Fist of Fusion, I have some mixed emotions as to which are my favorites, because they are all so good. Coming up in first place are the sesame chicken, loco moco, kalua pork sisig taco and kalua pork nachos. For the tacos and nachos, they fry their own shells and chips!!! 

The loco moco is made with mushroom gravy. Like real mushrooms. So very good.

My husband really enjoyed their Crispy Pork Belly Appetizer and furikaki churros.

The one thing that is weird about the location of this restaurant, is the parking lot. Make sure you don't back into the mound of dirt and unpaved portion in the middle of the parking lot. 

Convenient location, good food, good people, and clean. 4-star rating for me.

Saw this place on a video on FB. Just had to try it out. I love plate lunches in Hawaii and thought the  burrito was interesting. Definitely would recommend this place! Get your Katsu Chicken lunch plate!Delicious! Ono!

The first of three exciting restaurants coming to this shopping center, FoF has very good Hawaiian Fusion food. I think the bowls are a good value, with generous portions, and quality food. Really like the grilled pineapple side. I'll definitely be back, as FoF is a good alternate to the boring and predictable alternates in this part of town.

Definitely get your ono grindz on here. Super friendly staff and really good food. I had the Notorious R.I.B. (Boneless Rib) Island rice bowl with Mac salad. Very tender! Good vibes in the whole place!

Wow! I forget how much I can enjoy Hawaiian food! 

A friend of mine recommended this place and we loved it. I always have to talk about the bathroom so let me start now... It was immaculate. It was squeaky clean, new and nice. When we walked in, I couldn't help but notice the high ceilings and bright blue tealish walls. It was eye-catching and made me really happy.

The girl that took our order was super duper sweet. She even offered us a free churro to each of us. I thought my break yo mouth teriyakiburrito packed a punch of sweetness and tang. I must've been really hungry because I enjoyed every bite of it. Also, there's an awesome check in special for a pork belly appetizer. It had little dices of apple which was a pleasant surprise for me.

I can't wait to come back for more good eats and the friendly and fast service.

I first had the chance to try this amamzing food at the Great American Foodie Fest. I really enjoyed the food, so I wanted to try the L.A. location when we visited. I love the  Kahlua Pork Sisig taco. It is amazing and they don't skimp on the meat. Now, they serve a variety of corn on the cob. My personal favorite is the miso-corny. I will definitely be going to their new restaurant they just opened in Vegas. ^_^

Quality food, Good Vibes, & reasonable prices. Can't go wrong.

Foods I've ordered:

Short Rib Taco - 4.5/5
Kalua Pork Taco - 4/5
Kalbi Plate 5/5
Pork Belly Sisig 4.5/5
Veggies 3/5
Fried Spam Musubi 4/5

Only thing that was "disappointing" was that the veggies were 70% onion, and weren't very "veggie", but I won't dig a Hawaiian restaurant for their veggies. Food was delicious.

I refuse to tell you guys how many times I've been here in the last week since finding it.
I'm 100% addicted to their food. It's amazing. The customer service is just as good. I highly recommend trying it.

My go to place for Hawaiian food. Not only is it close to my house, but the food is delicious for its price. It does take a while until you get your food, especially during those lunch or dinner rush, but it is worth it.

Always on the lookout for new spots in town, we decided to give Fist of Fusion a go.
Ordered a Large Bowl (2 proteins and two sides) Sesame Chicken and Kalua Pork Sisig.
My sides were mac salad and grilled pineapple.

Observing the kitchen in action while we wait for our food, two cooks hustle (not in a good way)to get orders out as there are two people ahead of us and take out orders as well. A good 30 minutes pass and we finally get our order. Wifey luckily ordered a salad, but my bowl was a huge let down.

Filipinos and Hawaiians LOVE their rice. In fact, a pot of hot, fluffy rice is one of the first things you learn how to do in the kitchen growing up. The rice in my take out container wasn't hot, more cool to the touch, and  some grains were hard. Day old rice? Possibly, but that's the kind of rice you turn into fried rice, not serve it as is, especially when hot food should be hot, and for the prices you charge.

The "SISIG" was anything but...(simply a play on words)no jowl, no ear, no snout...straight up bland shredded pork butt topped with shredded cabbage and a white sauce. This was barely warm/room temp...its beginning to sound like
a CON-Fusion of Filipino/Hawaiian food.

The Sesame Chicken (Chicken Katsu topped with sesame seeds and a sweet shoyu concoction) looked and tasted like it was prepared ahead of time and not made to order
Inside wasn't hot, wasn't  juicy at all, and portion sizes for both proteins were on the skimpy side.

To make things worse, the mac salad was a bland mush, and the grilled pineapple was so sour, I spit it out as I proceeded to take a bite.
Too many shortcuts and overall taste makes me wish I had read LJ's review first. 

Another double edged sword is social media. Food should taste as good as it looks when its posted on Yelp, Instagram, or Facebook, but if you can't duplicate your delicious looking food consistently on a daily basis, then it's a huge disappointment ....NEXT!!!!

This place is bomb! We ordered to bowls and had lunch for approx $20. The food is fresh made and the quality is apparent in the taste and cuts of their proteins. The boneless short rib is melt in your mouth goodness. I loved the side choices options (grilled pineapple and Mac salad were my choices). I was also able to sub one scoop of my rice for green salad which was really nice because I pretty much have no self control when it comes to carbs. 

Mom Rating 3/5
The dine in area is pretty small and even though there weren't many people there when we visited it can get quite noisy. So although we started with a sleeping baby he was up within minutes on entering. However the cuisine and ambience is very kid friendly.

Three of us tried Fist of Fusion today. Restaurant was clean and busy. They have a beautiful Hawaiian mural. Greeted with aloha and order taken right away. We ordered 2 regular and 1 large bowl. Sesame chicken, teriyaki chicken, and a teriyaki & pork belly combo. You get 2 sides. All 3 of us got grilled pineapple which was delicious. The stir-fry veggies were very good. My daughter had to split open all her edamame pods. The sauce that comes with the bowls is amazing. The rice was delicious. A regular bowl had enough that my daughter and I took home leftovers. My husband ate all his large bowl. I gave them 4 stars because we waited quite awhile. They did give us a free order of the pork nachos which were very good and huge! They seemed a bit unorganized as we had to wait for o e bowl and one piece of pineapple. Regardless of the wait, we will be back. The food was excellent and the staff was friendly.

We ordered the Notorious RIB burrito, chicken katsu & pork belly, loco moco, kalua pork nachos, hot Cheetos and Uni-Corn elote and the lemonade. Everything was amazing! The staff were super friendly & we would def. go back!!!

Tried this place a few weeks ago and just got around to getting a yelp. The food was really delicious and the staff was really friendly. The kids loved the uniCORN and thought it was super fun. Just a tad pricey for a take out place.

I ordered from Postmates, so unfortunately I can't tell you anything about the service, parking, shape of the place itself. But I have to say that I really loved this place. 

I kept it classic and didn't try out any of the fusion stuff since I was trying this place out for the first time. I ordered one of the combination bowls with chicken katsu, chicken teriyaki, brown rice, grilled pineapple and mac salad! 

Let me just say, they didn't skimp out on anything. This thing came FULL. Worth the price of $9.99. 

My only thing was the mac salad was a bit too garlicky for my taste. Sometimes ended up overpowering the rest of the food. 

Will definitely try again to give whole experience.

I was excited to see this place open up walking distance from where I work. Ordered the teriyaki chicken bowl (small) with brown rice and sauteed vegetables, to-go. Made a last minute decision and got myself a tocino musubi and free pork belly app wtih yelp check in.  

PROS
+ good portion, small bowl should be enough to fill me up for lunch without the last minute impulse orders 
+ friendly staff, big smiles and greeted with "ALOHA"; apologized that I had to wait awhile 

CONS
- put in my free pork belly app order shortly after I ordered my main meal, but felt like I waited a lot longer than I needed to for it (party of 3 after me all got their orders before me)
- rice in musubi wasn't sticky enough to old it together, fell apart after my first bite
- very small portion of pork belly app, there were only a few pieces on a bed of slaw; it was free but I probably wouldn't order again

TAKEAWAYS
* get the small bowl again for lunch, get something other than the chicken teriyaki (short ribs, pork sisig)
* get the mac salad, always (sauteed vegetables?! what was i thinking?)
* try the burrito, if you're feeling dangerous
Wasn't a huge fan of the food. Went in there excited to get some awesome Hawaiian food, but the flavors were just disappointing.
Ok...so came here cause a friend of mine was here earlier this day...and sent me pictures of his food so I had to come and try.. and love it..left here all nice and full
High priced for the quality and quantity of food. Staff was very friendly and service was great.

Had dinner with the famsbams food and service was awesome. We remember their food truck a while back use to be called "Truck Norris" Manager even had us try furikake churros on the house. Will definitely come back.

Food was good but I definitely don't recommend getting the corn. I had to wait for my corn to be made which I didn't mind but when I finally got it was cold and had no taste ! Definitely disappointing .

We came here after an afternoon of hiking. There were 6 of us. Two ordered the chicken teriyaki bowl - regular size - and it was huge! It was good, too. The teriyaki sauce is a little different than I am used to but good! I had the Kalau pig bowl - again regular size is huge! It was good; I could have used a little more flavor. My husband ordered the R.I.B. burrito. He said it was good. I have never seen the mac salad in a burrito before. My sis ordered the spam musubi and spam katsu. The pink sauce was an interesting color and she liked it. They were kind enough to offer us churros! Three had them and said they were good. I would come back again, when I am on this side of town. It is different than the usual Hawaiian food we order and I like trying new things!

Did I just have a different experience compared to everyone else? I was disappointed at the food. I ordered the sesame chicken with brown rice, mac salad and stir fry veggies. My bowl was basically 70% rice with a few pieces of what tasted like chicken katsu and the mac salad lacked any flavor. My favorite part of the bowl was the stir fry veggies. 

My brother and I also ordered the kalua pork nachos to share. This was the highlight of our meal. I wish we had more of that cilantro lime sauce !

I am updating my review because the owner himself reached out to me and was very concerned with my experience. I told every detail and he was very apologetic. The fact that he reached out to me shows that he cares about his customers. Which is very impressive. My coworker and I decided to give the place a try again. We were welcomed right away. When we were ordering they walked us through the menu. They offered a drink, dessert or corn on a cob. We felt welcomed. The food was good (I recommend to try the crispy sisig, it was delicious), pink lemonade was also a favorite and the restaurant was clean. I am giving him the 4 stars for taking the time to reach out to me and for the much better experience I received on our return visit.

Fists of Fusion combines Hawaiian food with a Filipino twist. In pictures, the food looked amazing with large-appearing bowls with picturesque protein atop rice and mac salad. In reality, the serving sizes are much smaller. When compared to the nearby Island Flavor, which has become my standard for Hawaiian fare, it falls short. 

For lunch, the garlic shrimp plate was reminiscent of those shrimp trucks back on the islands. I enjoyed the heavy garlic flavor, and the buttery finish, but for $14, everything else was quite small and lackluster including the sides of rice and mac salad. I did think the shrimp was cooked better than the furikake shrimp from Island Flavor.

However, when it came to the rice bowls, you get a much better deal down the street on Durango. The servings of protein were small and un-filling. On top of that, the meat including the pork belly sisig and teriyaki chicken were haphazardly tossed together in the bowls. I think this place is deserving of another try for their crispy tocino spam musubi and their colorful elote, but I can only hope that the real deal is as mouth-watering as their social media pictures next time.

First timer...I usually stay away from anything with the word "fusion" in it, ESPECIALLY local (hawaiian) food. My local food should be, well, local food. Call me old fashioned but if I'm craving local food, I'd like it to be how it supposed to be, not "fused" It's kinda like having a favorite song you had since small kid time, but then somebody else sings it and changes it up... doesn't sound right huh? But it was on the way home so I decided to try it. I was greeted as soon I came in, the staff is full of aloha, very helpful. Clean, comfortable environment. I asked what was the popular dish and they suggested the notorious rib, so I got that. Took it home and ate it...meh... it's different. They put a sauce on it where the first couple bites were good, but then I got used to the flavor and it didn't appeal to me anymore. Not sure if I'll come back, this is just my opinion, I'm sure a lot of people like it

I live in the area and decided to try this place out for the first time with a couple of friends. 

My first impression was, this place looks very clean, nice and I really enjoyed the atmosphere. The staff was very welcoming and nice. This spot is basically if a Filipino Lady had a baby with an Hawaiian guy, their kid will be Fist of Fusion Island Grill :) 

The food was pretty good. I tried some of my friends orders and it was yummy. I ordered the garlic shrimp. I was so excited because it reminded me of the shrimp trucks in Hawaii. (Reason for not receiving 5 stars) The garlic shrimp had wayyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyy to much garlic and was very salty. I didn't even finish my meal. I tired my best to eat it but man, even with a glass of water next to me, I just couldn't do it.   

TIP: Be sure to check inn on yelp and get your free appetizer.

Found this hot and new on Yelp. We're in town from Mississippi to visit family, and we were looking for something that we can't get at home. Hawaiian/Asian Fusion fits that bill, as you can probably imagine. This is a counter service spot with a smaller, focused menu. We opted for the pork belly rice bowl and a short rib rice bowl. The small was plenty filling for a lunch portion and the flavors all worked. While we ate, a staffer offered us a churro on the house. It was amazing. It is covered in sugary goodness and addictively sweet! A+ for friendliness and helping us with the menu. Check this place out!

This was my first experience at fist of fusion and I was hoping for a better experience. I ordered a loco moco, chicken katsu, short rib, and Kalua pork sisig. The loco moco seemed relatively tough, but the gravy was pretty good. Short rib was tender and mildly flavorful. Kalua pork "sisig" might as well been called Kalua pork, instead of capitalizing on a trendy gimmick. But the most unfortunate occurrence was the metallic wire in the chicken katsu (pictured) that in my fiancee's plate. Not sure how it got in there but it was lodged between two pieces of katsu slices. Island Flavor still reigns supreme as the premier Island food hot spot, but I'm hoping for a better experience at fist of fusion one day.

Four stars because the food is bomb.
However  ,  we ordered 3 plates, and all of which they managed to get every single one of our sides WRONG.
Nothing new from what people have said previously ......
Really great food , great vibe! Hawaiian Filipino fusion! Yum! Good music even better service ! First time here got some free appetizers! Food was delicious and can't wait to come back !

The best Garlic Chicken in VegasCrispy, juicy & perfectly seasoned. The wait time is not too bad & the customer service is awesome. Very clean & welcoming. Very giving on their plates, lots of food & not bad for the price.

Some of the best Hawaiian fusion food I've had in town. They have a great take on some Hawaiian classics like spam musubi. Instead of just boring cabbage in your plates, they dress it up delightfully well. I high recommend this spot.

Great atmosphere, great people, great food. We had the notorious RIB burrito (local plate lunch wrapped into 1 burrito), loco moco, and the seseme chicken bowl with grilled pineapple, awesome kalua pork nachos, and Kalbi (winnah) 
Good feeling for this taste of home being close to home. Can't wait to try out more of the menu. Welcome to the neighborhood!

The restaurant has a pretty decent menu. I ordered a taco and a bowl, which I ended up trying 3 different meats from their rather large selection. The taco was decently good, however I must say the bowl was completely tasteless. The brown rice along with the meat were all very bland and under seasoned. I found myself trying to put different sauces on it just to try to bring out some kind of flavor. Unfortunately a little disappointing since everything on their menu and all the pictures online looked delicious.

I heard so many good things about this place, but my experience was not good at all! The restaurant was small and cramped. The staff was somewhat friendly, but not very professional. The food was the biggest disappointment because it was bland, and looked like a plate of soggy rice & meat.

I got the two item plate for $10. The veggies were great. The Macaroni, teriyaki chicken, and katsu was ok. Not sure I'd come back. I'd rather go to island style down the street if I were to crave Hawaiian again.

This is my first time trying Hawaiian food and I must say, I am in love. The place is small, so be sure to come at a good time. To order your food, you go up to the cashier and order your food and drinks then when your food is done, they will bring your food to you. 

When our food came out, we were not expecting huge proportion of food. I was so surprised when my food came out and I saw how heavy my bowl was. The food items that we ordered was amazing, every food item had different combination of flavors that complimented each other very well. This place was not a disappointment.

Had this for lunch today. We placed an order online for pick up. Large order and it was ready on time.

Super excited to try this food. I had a large mixed rice bowl. Brown rice, notorious rib, tofu , grilled veggies and grilled pineapple. Also the miso corney elote. 

The bowl was soaked in some kind of juice/thin gravy and cabbage all over the top of the bowl. The rice was soaked, veggies soggy. The rib was good but you can tell it is just stew meat. Tofu was fried well well done almost to hard to eat. 
I did not eat the rice, veggies or pineapple as they were all soaked with the liquid.

The one thing that they got right was the miso corney elote. Steamed perfect and the seasoning blend was so good. I did ask for it to be cut of the cob but that was not done. 

I hope that they take some of these reviews to heart and consider to change a few things and put out some really good food.

Been here 3x. 1st was dine in, 2nd was order pick-up, 3rd was dine-in again.  Not sure with the others but they mixed up the orders of the sides with the proteins. How hard is it to have ordered 3 rice bowls and the next time 2 rice bowls? On the 3rd, it took 20 minutes to wait (my 2nd visit took only 10 minutes wait). It's just that there was a young couple aside from us who just finished ordering. 
5 minutes later, a party of 2, then another party of 2, then 1. On the 20th minute they called the first couple's order, then ours came, then probably in 2 minute intervals everyone's orders arrived.
Hoping my order was worth the wait, I was observing the staff kinda giggling around while scooping out rice and sides. With the wait, i expected rice to be warm, meat and grilled pineapple still should be hot as I expected because of the wait, but it was not.
1st and 2nd visit, yes my sides were mixed up but the food was hot so I refused to mind it. But this 3rd visit did not meet my expectation at all. Sorry, just being honest.

Sweet baby Jesus this place is delicious! I've passed it many times because I assumed it was standard Hawaiian like L&L, or Ohana. Nope! It's more like Braddahs which, conveniently, is no longer in the area . 

This place is like your standard taco, burrito, rice bowl type restaurant, but with a Hawaiian style twist. The primary meat selections are a kalbi type boneless short rib, chicken, and pork belly. 

For lunch, I had the "Notorious R.I.B" burrito which is the marinated short rib meat with rice, Mac salad, and a kimchi slaw. While waiting for my food, they brought out a sample churro. I'm not big on sweets, but it was interesting that it had sort of a coconut sugar on it and some seaweed flakes. A bit sweet for my taste, but I still ate the whole thing.

I also had a fried pork belly appetizer. It comes in a bowl on top of some apple coleslaw type deal. It was really good, but too much food for me at this point. I still ate most of it. 

I'll definitely be back once Buffalo is done being torn up.

When I first saw the pictures I thought this is love. 

Mac salad in a burrito? Yes please! However, the menu online doesn't match what is on the website. I wanted the rib and chicken burrito and I said no kimchi salad as it states on their website that kimchi is included. Sooooo I felt like a dummy. My husband and I ordered the chicken plate burrito and the other chicken burrito with cheese and no Mac salad. Obviously the second chicken burrito didn't make an impression but that chicken plate burrito was delish! I can probably eat that any day if it wasn't loaded with so many carbs! One burrito is def more than enough for lunch and I actually only ended up eating half! The spam musubi was also delish but I was full from my half of the burrito. 

Overall, it's a win win. They are opened on Sunday's now and I will be back!

Tonight we finally tried this place and I ordered Pork Belly Sisig and Boneless Kalbi and after the first bite I wanted to throw up.  The sisig tasted spoiled and the creamy aioli does not go with the Kalbi.  I understand that you call this place "Twist of Fusion" but I think the concept is wrong.  I wanted to run outside and throw up .  After leaving the place I threw up what I ordered in the parking lot.  The food is greasy and did not taste right.  I think I just had food poisoning.  It's not worth it.  If you want your money worth, go to Island Flavor or just BBQ your own food.  Sorry but I had to share my bad experience.

I tried this place for the first time last week. I work at the Sola Salons in the shopping center so this place has been on my radar for awhile. I ordered the Chicken Taco with Mac Salad. The food is delicious. Cute little place tucked in the corner of the shopping center. 

I took off one star because the service is slow. I wouldn't recommend if you're pressed for time.

I cannot say enough good things about this place. Me, and my wife went here on a quick dinner date. We were blown away. The food is amazing. Everything we have tried here is cooked to perfection, and flavorful. Since trying this on a whim I have made it a regular lunch spot. Eating here at least once a week. I'm personally a huge fan of the chicken katsu, and grilled pineapple. The atmosphere is fun, laid back, and perfect for any occasion. The staff is friendly, and caters to your questions, and needs. Also, for the quality of food, and amount you get, the price is great as well! Two thumbs way up!

Usually go to another Island Grill and this exceeded my expectations!! Not only was the food delicious but service was spot on which is definitely lacking at the other Island Grill we used to frequent!! 

The Kalbi tasted almost like my mother's, food was all hot and fresh and if you get the chance to try their honey sriracha or honey garlic wings.... DO SO! Don't hesitate!!  

We will most certainly be back!! Job well done!!

Yet another quality dining spot in SW Vegas!  Friendly staff and tasty Hawaiian fare make this a neighborhood favorite.  In addition to Black Sheep, Born And Raised, Fukuburger, Goodwich, Japaniero, etc Fist of Fusion is helping the SW take over the game in LV!

We were so excited to try this place because we consider ourselves plate lunch/Hawaiian food connoisseurs lol. Unfortunately the seasonings were all off (it was pretty clear they were not tasting what they were cooking). The soda machine was down so no beverages which was a disappointment since there was a group of us for my husband's birthday. I had the shrimp plate and it was SUPER salty and not up to par with shrimp trucks on Oahu. People were very friendly that worked there but all in all not as tasty as were hoped for.

It's okay. Always friendly staff here. I like the teriyaki chicken but lately I think it's too sweet. Stir fried veggies seemed a little soggy (I like slight crunch) and soaked in oil or whatever sauce they used.

I love supporting local businesses but unfortunately this one was a bust, after waiting 45 mins not even joking for shrimp plate and loco moco I was a little upset but I think the longer the wait fresh the food will be no my shrimp was cold and flavorless highly dissatisfied after hearing great reviews about this place and right by my house , if the shrimp was fresh maybe it would have some flavor all I tasted was the over powering wine overall experience sucked and half the soda drinks out of order
Awesome place if you are looking for something new to try. Portions are huge, prices are great, and food was yummy. Also loved the cute atmosphere inside!
Everyone was friendly and the mango salsa was great . I didn't enjoy the bowl as much

Came to check this place out for ourselves and i must say that i like it. Very aloha spirited staff that makes people like me feel like we're back in home in Hawaii. Really good sized portions and tasty food. Will definitley come back again! #supportlocal

Don't bother with this place. Go to Island Flavor for awesome Hawaiian food. 
The food was burnt and sent our cold. Over priced too.

Nice menu with so many things to try, I loved the garlic chicken and great value.

Friendly staff, quick service, cool decor, easy to find and a super casual dining spot.
Got their garlic chicken and Notorious RIB. Both was ono and this place is one of my go to spots.

Let me tell you a little story about this place. The day I visited it was cold. I walked in and it's nice and warm just like Hawaii. Instant atmosphere satisfaction. I food was decently priced and it tasted like heaven. I ordered two things because I'm fat. The notorious RIB burrito and Kalua Pork SiSig. The cashier was nice and explained the sizes, She was extremely knowledgeable about the sizes; probably because she's a bit chunky. Overall this place is 10/10!
Owner made contact to make this right and try there food again. Willing to go back for a second trial run. To be continued....

Checked out Fist of Fusion for the first time. Located in the SW area off of Buffalo and Warm Springs. The small strip mall they are located in is semi new and still construction on going currently.

Parking was not hard to find maybe due to the mall not being overly crowded yet. Entering the establishment it is pretty small inside with limited seatings and a walk up area to order food. The menu has its local touches, being from Hawaii we are particular with our local food selections. The menu does have alot of local touches but how does it taste???? 
We give it a 4/5.... 

On our menu today was the Loco Moco, Hawaii folks know exactly what that is. Hamburger patties over rice smothered with brown gravy and topped with over easy eggs ( or however you prefer your egg) i like my yolk to be dripping all over.. mmmmmmmm!!!!! The hubby had the island rice bowls, they have 3 different sizes to choose from dependent on how hungry you are. He had the 1 choice meat (Kalbi short ribs +$2 additional) 2 choice sides (stir fry veggies and mac salad) and of course WHITE RICE but they do have brown if you prefer it! We also tried the fried spam musubi so ono!!!!! And they have a POG lemonade say whattttt!!!! Real good! When ordering we peeped some corn on the cobs with different toppings. Elote, Flaming hot cheetoes were some of the flavors but hubby opted for the traditional butter and salted corn.

The ambience is definitely Hawaii esque. Local jams playing and a beautiful mural of home. I definitely wanna be back to try the garlic shrimp plate little on the pricier side but that ono pog lemonade is calling my name!

This place is so delicious and different from other affordable places I usually eat at. It's not around much, but it was pretty close to the highway. I had the RIB with bone in. It was a little chewy and had a lot of tendons that aren't my favorite, but the flavor was good. My friend had some crispy chicken which was absolutely wonderful! Would recommend the chicken and definitely recommend checking this place out!

I love that there's a new quick Hawaiian fusion spot nearby! What lured me in was the sisig everything! Lmao I was excited to see what it's all about here. I heard good things about this place and I knew it was fairly new so here we're going to be some flaws.

I love their menu options and the selection. It's a cute small joint that serves it purpose and does a good job! My only critique is once you place your order it does take quite a while to receive your order. I do understand that they make your order fresh to order, but it does take longer than usual. 

I admit the wait was worth it, I love the sweet and salty savory taste of the Crispy Pork Belly appetizer (plus when I came in it was free with a yelp check in!). I order a rice bowl with the crispy pork as well and it was basically the same as the appetizer but I didn't mind it! It was still sooo amazing and yummy! I will be coming back to try more! Good job Fist of Fusion!

The staff here are very friendly, and helpful! The food flavors are definitely worth a try. I found the short ribs a little grizzly but the sauce was great! It might not be your thing because it is new and different and some people can't appreciate that, but you need to give them a try.

First time coming here. Food was great! Love the Kalua with unions and jalapeo cooked into it. Their lemonade is off the charts delicious!!! Best lemonade I've ever had. Wish I lived on this side of town, but will definitely eat here again when in the area. Good  food, great staff!

BS +
I really tried to like you guys.  I really truly did.  I just left this place today and had to write a fresh review in my brain unlike their side salad.  I been dying to come here since December.  I read about the sisig always running out and at 12pm I couldn't believe you guys don't have it.  Ok first, let's talk about the location and space.
